txt.en: Butter is the final ingredient for the pies. With that, the baking can then begin.

'The final thing I need is butter. It is the most important of all ingredients. It will bind the flour for the crust, thicken the jam into the filling, and the eggs into the wash.

'Butter is made by first milking the cows. Once you have enough milk, go to the butter-churn and begin churning. It may take some time, but you'll know it's ready once it begins to thicken.

'The cows are at a farm just east of here. The churn is not far from them.'
The cows are at a farm to the east.
'The fresher the butter, the better the pies, I always say. Now, let's get these put into the oven.'
The butter-churn is near the cows on Northcotton Farm.\n\nThe next step to making butter is to churn the milk.
Rosa Brockhouse is at the southern part of the Northcotton Farm.\n\nRosa Brockhouse will want to get the butter so she can finish the pies.
'Butter starts as milk, and milk starts in a cow.'
'Now you need to churn the milk. It might take a while.'
Bring the butter to Rosa Brockhouse
